description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of Planning Permission 15/15243/FUL to amend drawings to include new soil vent pipes and soil vent pipe cowls, new extract vents on roof, new boiler flues on the front facade, new rain water pipes, new  windows on the rear facade; new gas meters and external luminaries at the rear,  the removal of existing chimney stacks and parapets; external changes to windows, doors and railings
decision_conditions: The facing materials to be used in the construction of the building shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The car parking, servicing and manoeuvring areas shown on the approved drawing shall be provided with a hard, bound, dust-free surface, adequately drained before the development is occupied for the purpose hereby permitted.  The respective areas shall be kept free from obstruction at all times, and shall not thereafter be used for any other purposes other than those shown on the approved drawing.Reason:  To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice thefree 	flow of traffic or conditions of general safety on adjoining highways and that 	adequate parking servicing and manoeuvring provision is made in accordance 	with Policies DM9 (Managing Vehicle Use for New Development) and Policy 	DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House 		Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of secure cycle parking facilities providing space for a minimum of 20 cycles, for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development hereby approved have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The play space hereby approved shall be laid out and equipped prior to the occupation of any of the dwelling houses and permanently retained in accordance with plans which shall have previously been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and such area shall not be used for any other purpose.Reason: In order to ensure the provision of a children's playground for occupiers of this development and to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of the Delivery and Servicing Plan submitted 17th June 2016, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policies DM9 (Managing Vehicle Use for New Development) and Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Refuse storage facilities and recycling facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, such facilities to be permanently retained at the site.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

All works on site shall take place in accordance with the Construction Management Plan (May 2018) approved by the Local Planning Authority under reference number 18/14326/COND. Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential 	occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in 	accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Condition 1 (Materials, Colour and Texture of External Finish) - Officers have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this can now be approved.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 1 (Materials, Colour and Texture of External Finish) of permission 20/02327/NMA is hereby fully approved.
Condition 8 (Refuse Store) - Officers have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this can now be approved.
Condition 11 (Boundaries) - Officers have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this can now be approved.
Conditions 15 (Landscape Scheme) - The Tree & Landscape officer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied this can now be approved.
Condition 10 (Drainage Strategy Report) - The Lead Local Flood Authority have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this can now be approved.
The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 10 (Drainage Strategy Report) of planning permission 20/00825/FUL is hereby fully approved.

Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.

Please provide a copy of block plan scaled 1:500, providing a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.

Please provide existing and proposed floor plans at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.The submitted existing floor plans do not have a scale bar.

Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.The submitted location plan  have two roads but not the name of the road. Please revise the location plan with the name of the roads.

Please provide a copy of proposed block plan scaled 1:500, providing a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.Note:  As per your query regarding adjoining propoerties to rear and opposite, you can show small part of the adjoining properties to the rear and opposite, please show full outline to the side.

Please provide existing and proposed floor plans of greenhouse and outbuilng at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.The submitted floor plans are not labelled. The submitted plan of greenhouse does not show the position of the door and windows

Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.The proposed site is outline in black in the submitted location plan, we require location plan with red outline in the proposed site.

Please provide a copy of block plan scaled 1:500, providing a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.Note: We received the proposed site plans with different design schemes which is not mentioned in the description.
